data.title: Delgado Funeral Home
data.text:
Obituaries

Sepulveda

Gabriel Sepulveda, born September 14, 1969, passed away on August 18, 2019 at the age of 49. He is survived by His mother: Maria Elena Sepulveda; sons: Gabriel Jr. Elijah, Caleb; daughters: Lezeth, Jessline; sisters: Maria Ellis, Frances Riojas; Brother: Ricardo Sepulveda; and 4 Grandchildren.

Visitation will begin on Friday, August 23, 2019 at 4:00pm at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St., San Antonio, Texas, 78207) with a rosary recited at 7:00pm with services concluding at 9:00pm.

Barbosa

Maria C. R. Barbosa, born in Mexico on August 11, 1951 and went to be with the Lord on August 16, 2019 at the age of 68. She was preceded in death by her Parents: Pedro Rodriguez and Maria Cardona. She is survived by her Husband: Hector Barbosa; Sons: Hector Barbosa Jr., Jesus Barbosa, Gabriel Barbosa and Steve Barbosa; Daughters: Olga Leticia Barbosa and Patricia Barbosa; Sisters: Juana Carlos, Gloria Cardona and Maria Margarita Sanchez; Brother: Franscico Javier Trujillo, and 17 Grandchildren and 28 Great-grandchildren.

Visitation will begin on Wednesday, August 21, 2019 at 4:00pm at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St., San Antonio, Texas, 78207) with a Rosary recited at 7:00pm. Funeral procession will depart on Thursday, August 22, 2019 at 9:30am for Mass at St. Agnes Catholic Church at 10:00am. Interment to follow at First Memorial Park.

Rodriguez

Mario G. Rodriguez, born in San Antonio, Texas on July 8, 1951 and went to be with the Lord on August 15, 2019 at the age of 68. He was preceded in death by his Parents: Pilar and Cruzita Rodriguez; Son: Mark Anthony Rodriguez; Sister: Jovita Coronado; Brothers: Pilar Rodriguez Jr. and Fernando Rodriguez, and Great-grandson: Mario Matthew Rodriguez V. He was survived by his Wife: Maria E. Rodriguez; Sons: Mario Rodriguez Jr. (Irene) and Gabriel Rodriguez (Diana Casso); Daughter: Lisa R. James (Andrew); Sisters: Mary Galvan and Yolanda Torres; Brothers: Gilbert Rodriguez, Raul Rodriguez, Arturo Rodriguez, John Rodriguez and Ricky Rodriguez; Granddaughters: Abany, Desiree, Mercedes, Melina, Marisa, Gabriella, Giana, Neveah and Iliana; Grandsons: Mario Matthew, Luis, Mark Anthony, Nathan Ryan, Andrew Rashaad, Mario IV and Mark Angel and 11 Great-grandchildren and numerous Nieces, Nephews and Friends.

Visitation will begin on Thursday, August 22, 2019 at 4:00pm at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St., San Antonio, Texas, 78207) with a Rosary recited at 7:00pm. Funeral will depart on Friday, August 23, 2019 at 9:45am for Mass at Our Lady of Perpetual Help at 10:30am. Interment to follow at Chapel Hill Memorial Park.

Ortiz

Abelardo Ibarra Ortiz went to be with the Lord August 9, 2019, just two and one half weeks shy of his 104th birthday. Abelardo was born in San Pedro Coahuila, Mexico, August 28, 1915, and had the privilege of meeting with President Lazaro Cardenas of Mexico personally.

Survivors include son, Alfredo Vasquez, daughter, Magdelena (Roman) Flores, daughter, Felicitas Garcia (Charles) Bloom, son, Abelardo Jr. Ortiz, son, Manuel (Antonia) Ortiz, son, Gustavo (Federica) Ortiz, son, Juan Ortiz, son, Jesus (Rosa) Ortiz, daughter, Josefina (Arturo) Jimenez, and many grandchildren.

Visitation will begin on Tuesday, August 20, 2019 at 4:00pm at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St. San Antonio, Texas, 78207) with a Rosary recited at 7:00pm. Funeral will depart on Wednesday, August 21, 2019 at 9:15am for Mass at Resurrection of the Lord at 10:00am. Interment to follow at San Fernando Cemetery II.

Perez

Noveliyah Aide Perez, born on May 16, 2019 in San Antonio, Texas and went to be with the Lord on August 2, 2019. She is survived by her Parents: Juan Ramon Perez and Sandra Aide Gomez; Sister: Xamileth Aguilar; Brothers: Armando Aguilar; Adriel and Tadeo; Grandparents: Sandra Rodriguez; Ofelia Barbosa and Jesus Perez, and numerous Aunts and Uncles and Cousins.

Visitation will begin on Thursday, August 15, 2019 at 4:00pm at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St., San Antonio, Texas, 78207) with a Rosary recited at 7:00pm. Funeral will depart on Friday, August 16, 2019 at 9:30am for Mass at Sacred Heart Catholic Church at 10:00am. Interment to follow at San Fernando Cemetery II.

Luna

Jesse B. Luna Jr., born in San Antonio, Texas on August 2, 1968 and went to be with the Lord on August 3, 2019 at the age of 51. He was preceded in death by his Parents: Jesus L. Luna and Elena Luna and Brother: Ramon B. Luna. He is survived by his Wife: Dorothy R. Don; Stepson: Gilbert Don; Daughters: Marissa D. Luna and Jenifer D. Luna; Sisters: Dolores; Gloria; Joann; Pauline; Maria and Irma.

Visitation will begin on Sunday, August 18, 2019 at 4:00pm at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St. San Antonio, Texas, 78207) with a Rosary recited at 7:00pm. On Monday, August 19, 2019 everyone to meet at St. Timothy Catholic Church for a Funeral Mass at 10:00am. A Gravesite service to follow at San Fernando Cemetery III.

Peralez

Pete A Peralez, born April 24, 1954, passed away on August 1, 2019 at the age of 65. He is survived by his Sisters: Yolanda Rodela, Esa Salinas; brother: Raymond Leal.

Visitation will begin on Saturday, August 17, 2019 at 9:00am at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St., San Antonio, Texas, 78207) with a Prayer Service at 11:00am. Service will conclude at 12:00pm.

Renteria

Maria Ramona Renteria, born in San Antonio, Texas on August 19, 1963 and went to be with the Lord on August 6, 2019 at the age of 55. She was preceded in death by her Parents: Ramon Renteria and Anita Renteria; Daughter: Anita Hernandez; Brothers: Willie, Raymond , Richard and Andy. She is survived by her Sons: Christopher J. Renteria (Melinda), Charles Solis and Joaquin Hernandez; Daughters: Charlena Solis and Rosalinda Brown; Sisters: Jeanette and Debbie; Brothers: Enrique, Robert and Mercedes, and 17 Grandchildren and 1 Great-grandchild on the way.

Visitation will begin on Sunday, August 11, 2019 at 11:00am at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St., San Antonio, Texas, 78207) with a Prayer Service at 1:00pm. Service will conclude at 2:00pm.

Crispin

Juan Crispin Aranda, born February 9, 1957 and went to be with the Lord on August 6, 2019 at the age of 62. He is survived by his Wife: Hilaria Banda; Sons: Javier Crispin, Juan Antonio Crispin and Herman Crispin; Daughter: Juanita Crispin; Sister: Socorro Crispin; Brother: Juan Martin Crispin and 6 Grandchildren.

Visitation will begin on Friday, August 9, 2019 at 9:00am at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St., San Antonio, Texas, 78207) with a Chapel Service at 12:00pm. Service will conclude a 1:00pm.

Garcia

Jasmine Garcia, born April 13, 1994 went to be with the Lord on August 6, 2019 at the age of 25. She is survived by her Parents: Raymond and Pauline Garcia; Sisters: Nancy Cepeda and Desirae Garcia; and Grandfather: Silverio Estrada.

Visitation will begin on Saturday, August 10, 2019 at 9:00am at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St., San Antonio, Texas, 78207) with a service at 12:00pm. Services will Conclude after the service.

Munoz

Isabel Estrada Munoz, born on July 8, 1932 and went to be with the Lord on August 6, 2019 at the age of 87. She was preceded in death by her Parents: Felix and Tomasa Munoz and her Husband: Blas Estrada Rodriguez. She is survived by her Son: Martin Estrada and his wife Rosa Estrada; Daughters: Martha Ortiz, Hilda Garcia, and Leticia Garcia; Sister: Maria De La Luz Munoz; Brother: Pedro Munoz; 13 Grandchildren; 36 Great Grandchildren and 2 Great great Grandchildren.

Visitation will begin on Friday, August 9, 2019 at 4:00pm at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St., San Antonio, Texas, 78207) with a Rosary rectied at 7:00pm. Funeral Mass will be on Saturday, August 10, 2019 at Sacred Heart Catholic Church (2114 W. Houston St. San Antonio, Texas 78207) at 10:00am. Everyone will meet at the church. Services will conclude following the funeral mass.

Rodriguez

“MOM”

Juanita “Juana” Garcia Rodriguez born March 4, 1948 went to be with our Lord on Sunday, August 4, 2019 at the age of 71. She was born in Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas, Mexico. Mom loved gardening, breakfasts with her brother and sister, and spending time with her grandchildren. She is preceded in death by her father Salvador Garcia, mother Vicenta Paredes Garcia, husband Francisco Rodriguez, son Francisco Javier Rodriguez, sisters Julia Gonzales, Margarita Castillo, Gloria Arechiga, Sylvia Garcia, and brothers Isaac Garcia, Salvador Garcia Jr. and Vicente Garcia. Mom is survived by her daughter Griselda R. Olivarez (Jorge), her loving grandchildren Isabella Giselle Olivarez and Jorge Francisco Olivarez, sister Ninfa Ramos, brothers Roberto Garcia, Alfredo Garcia, Jesus Garcia, Ignacio Garcia (adopted and more like a son) and numerous nieces, nephews and extended family. Juanita’s doors were always open to anyone in need and was a surrogate mother for many in her family.

Visitation will begin on Wednesday, August 7, 2019 at 4:00pm at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St., San Antonio, Texas, 78207) with a Prayer Service at 7:00pm. Funeral will depart on Thursday, August 8, 2019 at 10:00am with interment at San Jose Burial Park.

Martinez

Our dear mother, Elma Medina Martinez entered into rest on Wednesday, June 12, 2019. She traveled the world living in the Philippines, Japan, Scotland & San Francisco. She attended Pan American University, Tyler junior college as well as Stephen F. Austin University. She was a bilingual special education teacher at Peete elementary in Tyler Texas. She ended her career at the San Antonio state hospital. She was preceded in death by 8 siblings, husband Joe L. Martinez and oldest son Robert(Bobby). She is survived by 4 children. Richard, Norma, Nelda & Destini. 5 grandchildren, Justin(Ellen), Dymond, Jazmin, Emrald & Azalya. As well as 2 sisters, Ella & Elva.

A memorial service in her honor, followed by a lunch will be held at Trinity Baptist Church located at 319 E. Mulberry Ave. San Antonio, Tx. 78212 on Sunday August 11, 2019 at 2pm.

Onzon

Maria Josefina Onzon, Born December 7, 1936, went to be with the Lord July 29, 2019. Our mother was very outgoing, happy, cheerful and met all of lifes adversities with a smile. She was a very hard worker throughought her life, always made time for her family and her love of traveling, going to Rome twice in her life time. When home she loved tending to her garden as well as making flower arrangements. Our mother was a devout Catholic who was an active member of her church, St. Philip of Jesus.

She was preceded in death by her loving Husband: Henry Onzon; Daughter: Mary Jane Martinez; Sister: Dominga Lopez; Brothers: Juanito, Valentin Jr., Jesse; and Great-granddaughter: Samantha Garza. She is survived by her Sons Miguel Martinez (Elizabeth), and Raymond Martinez, Daughters: Rosamary Balleza, Angelita Gonzalez (Reyes), and Isabel Mata; Sisters: Victoria, Petra, Gloria, Mimi, and Janie; Brothers: Tony, David, Eddie, and Bobby; 14 grandchildren, 25 great-grandchildren and one on the way.

Visitation will begin on Tuesday, August 13, 2019 at 4:00pm with a Rosary recited at 7:00pm at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St., San Antonio, TX 78207). Funeral procession will depart Wednesday, August 14, 2019 at 9:00am for a Mass at St. Philip of Jesus Catholic Church at 9:45am. Interment to follow at Fort Sam Houston National Cemetery.

Payton

Barbara Kaye Payton, born on July 25, 1966 in Bexar County, Texas and went to be with the Lord on July 21, 2019 at the age of 52. She was preceded in death by her Husband: James Payton and Brother: Mike Neeley. She is survived by her Son: Sonny James Payton; Daughter: Darlene Galindo; Sisters: Sandra and Carolyn; Brother: Charles Neeley and 5 Grandchildren.

Visitation will begin on Monday, July 29, 2019 at 4:00pm at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St., San Antonio, Texas, 78207) with a Service at 7:00pm. Funeral Home will open on Tuesday, July 30, 2019 at 8:30am. A Chapel Service will start at 10:00am with Interment to follow at Barney Williams Cemetery.

Ortiz

Robert C. Ortiz, born February 17, 1956, went to be with the Lord on July 24, 2019. He was preceded by his Parents: Fidencio and Tavita Ortiz; Brother: Richard Ortiz and Sister: Sylvia R. Ortiz. He is survived by his Wife: Ernestina Ortiz; Daughters: April A. Ortiz ( Fernando), Marsha A. Barrientos (Joe ) and Elizabeth A. Villanueva (Robert); Son: Mario D. Pacheco Jr. (Cristina); Siblings: Fedencio C. Ortiz, Jimmy Ortiz, Gilbert Ortiz, John E. Ortiz, Rebecca Garcia, Carmen Ortiz, Maria Erlinda Pena and Lucia Ortiz. Mr. Ortiz loved the company of his 15 Grandchildren and 6 Great-grandchildren.

We were blessed to have a strong role model as a Father. He loved unconditionally and accepted everyone with open arms. He was a hard worker and dedicated his life to his family. Our loved one will be truly missed and thought of with the memories left behind.

Visitation will begin on Tuesday, July 30, 2019 at 4:00pm at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St., San Antonio, Texas, 78207) with a Prayer Service at 7:00pm. A Chapel Service will begin at 10:00am on Wednesday, July 31, 2019. Interment to follow at First Memorial Park Cemetery.

Almanza

Jacinta Almanza, born September 11, 1946, went to be with the Lord on July 20, 2019 at the age of 72. She was preceded in death by her Parents: Rosalio and Ramona Elizondo; son: Jesus Almanza; brothers: Pablo, Carlos, and Mario Elizondo. She is survived by her Husband: Candido Almanza; sisters: Lucia, Olalia, Franxisca, Oralia; Brothers: Eduardo, and Rosalio Jr.; and numerous nephews and nieces.

Visitation will begin on Thursday, July 25, 2019 at 4:00pm at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St., San Antonio, Texas, 78207) with a prayer service recited at 6:00pm. Funeral procession will depart on Friday, July 26, 2019 at 10:00am for interment in Frio County Cemetery in Pearsall, Texas.

Maciel

Elida R. Maciel, born May 11, 1946 in San Antonio, Texas and went to be with the Lord on July 18, 2019 at the age of 73. She was preceded in death by her Parents: Franciso Ramos and Maria Ramos; Husband: Juan C. Martinez; Son: Ernest Maciel Jr. She is survived by her Sons: Richard Maciel; Eddie Maciel; Frank Maciel and Christopher Maciel; Daughters: Mary Favela; Janie Tamez; Dolores Garcia; Ernestina Gil and Christina Maciel, and numeous Grandchildren and Great-grandchildren.

Visitation will begin on Monday, July 22, 2019 at 4:00pm at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St., San Antonio, Texas, 78207) with a Rosary recited at 7:00pm. Service will conclude at 9:00pm.

Aguinaga

Josefina V. Aguinaga, born October 14, 1945 in Lockhart, Texas and went to be with the Lord on July 11, 2019 at the age of 73. She was preceded in death by her Parents: Serapio and Josefine Villarreal; Husband: Jose Z. Aguinaga; Son: Mike Aguinaga; Brother: Raymond Villarreal; Grandchild: Alfie Aguinaga. She is survived by her Sons: Rick Villarreal, Robert Aguinaga, Alfred Aguinaga, Armando Aguinaga and Charlie Aguinaga; Daughters: Beatrice Sanchez, Dolores Aguinaga and Loretta Mora; Sister: Ofelia; Brother: Junior Villarreal and numerous Grandchildren.

Visitation will begin on Tuesday, July 16, 2019 at 3:00pm at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St., San Antonio, Texas, 78207) with a Rosary recited at 7:00pm. Funeral procession will depart on Wednesday, July 17, 2019 at 9:45am for a funeral mass at St. Frances Cabrini Church at 10:30am. Interment will follow at Rossville Cemetery in Rossville (Atascosa County), Texas.

Luna

Luis Valenzuela Luna, born June 11, 1949 in Austin, Texas and went to be with the Lord on June 19, 2019 at the age of 70. Mr. Luna was a 1968 Graduate of George W. Branckenridge High School (ROTC and Drill Team) and served in the U.S. Army from 1969-1972. He was preceded in death by his Parents: Ismael G. and Reyes V. Luna; Daughter: Jane Roxanne Luna; Sister: Rosalinda L. Gonzales; Brothers: Ismael V. Luna Jr. and Joe V. Luna. He is survived by his Son: Luis Luna Jr.; Granddaughter: Jocelynn Parke; Sisters: Irene L. Mejia (Ernesto), Carmen L. Alvarado, Sylvia L. Felan; Bernie L. Vasquez (Carlos) and Charlotte L. Cavazos (Andrew). He is also survived by Aunts, Uncle and Cousins from Austin, Cedar Creek, Georgetown and surrounding areas, and also Cousins from San Antonio.

Family would like to give a Special Thanks to our cousin Ray Barrera for being like a brother to Louie for the last 12 Years.

Visitation will begin on Monday, July 8, 2019 at 9:30m at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St., San Antonio, Texas, 78207) with a Service at 11:30am. A Graveside service will be at Fort Sam Houston National Cemetery at 1:15pm.

Guerrero

Javier Guerrero, born on March 24, 1964 and went to be with the Lord on June 30, 2019 at the age of 55. Javier accomplished many great things in the short time he was here. He joined the Police Force in his early 20s and would become Chief of Police in Alton, Texas. On September 21, 1989, Javier was one of the first responders to the scene of a tragic accident where the driver of a Dr. Pepper truck collided with a school bus, causing the school bus to enter a caliche pit filled with water killing 21 Junior and Senior High School Students. Javier would move on to the Houston Police Department where he joined SWAT and would later retire after 24 years of service. After retirement Javier opened a security company, Metropolitan Security Service which had over 100 employees.

Javier was a great Son, Father, Husband, Grandfathter Brother, Uncle and Friend. His journey here has ended too soon. As he embraces on his new journey the Lord has given him, he will soarly missed but never forgotten. He was preceded in death by his Brother: Jaime Guerrero. He is survived by his Parents: Bonifacio and Emma Guerrero; Wife: Spring A. Guerrero; Sons: Vidar Guerrero (Beatrice); Matthew Nathaniel Guerrero and Vidblain Mora (Jatonna); Stepson: Cole Sullivan; Stepdaughter: Katelyn Grady; Sister: Imelda G. De La Rosa; Brothers: Dennis Garza and Daniel Nishara; and Grandchildren: Hailey, Vicente, Natalie, Reno and Caleb.

In lieu of flowers family is asking for Donations.

Visitation will begin on Friday, July 5, 2019 at 4:00pm at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St., San Antonio, Texas, 78207) with a Service at 7:00pm. Burial will be at a later date in Mission, Texas.

Hernandez

In the book of life, God knows our first breath and last before we do. God knew Tomas' first breath on November 27, 1983. And on June 25, 2019-God knew his last. God knew his last. God was present with Tomas even through death. In tragic times we must remember only God holds our healing, and we can only trust in him.

Tomas (Chino) Hernandez Jr. was born in San Antonio, Texas to Tomas and Reynalda Hernandez. Our Tomas was Comical, a bright spirit, and radiated a magnetic energy that people gravitated towards. He became a father and husband to Esmeralda Barrera along with two beautiful daughters, Evelyn and Ivory Hernandez.

Tomas is survived by his parents Tomas and Reynalda Hernandez; his wife: Esmeralda Barrera; his daughters Evelyn and Ivory Hernandez. Along with his loving siblings, he is survived by his sister; Maria G. Mancillas, brother; Jorge A. Godina, brother, Eduardo T. Godina; sisters; Rita T. Godina, and sister; Janie Bocanegra.

In lieu of flowers, memorial donations may be made to the Go Fund Me account: link

https://www.gofundme.com.1og5pd1fxc

The family would like to extend their gratitude to everyone who has shown love and support during this time of grief.

Visitation will begin on Saturday, June 29, 2019 at 9:00am-2:00pm at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St., San Antonio, Texas, 78207). The Funeral Service will be immediately after the visitation at the time of 3:00pm-7:00pm located at the Iglesia Cristiana Herederos Del Reino (500 Chipinque St., San Antonio, Texas, 78237).

Davila

Dolores Davila, loving mother, Grandmother, and Wife, went to be with the lord June 13, 2019. She is survived by her husband: Carlos Silva; sons: Nicolas Davila, Rudy Silva, Paul Davila; Daughters: Jessica Davila, Margarita Hinojosa; Sisters: Olga Davila, Rosie Gallegos, Margie Galloegos; brother: Bobby Davila; 14 Grandchildren.

Visitation will begin on Tuesday, June 25, 2019 at 4:00pm at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St., San Antonio, Texas, 78207) with a Rosary at 7:00pm. Funeral will depart Wednesday at 9:15am for a 10:00am mass at Our Lady of Perpetual Help. Services will conclude after the service.

Cantu

Gilbert Cantu Jr., born on January 26, 1944 and went to be with the Lord on June 15, 2019 at the age of 75. He was preceded in death by his Parents: Gilberto Cantu Sr. and Clara Salas Cantu; Brothers: David and Juan Cantu and Sister: Estella Alonzo. He is survived by his Sons: Rick Vega and Eric Vega (Lucy); Daughters: Brandy Lynn Parks, Clara Pruneda, Rosalinda Cantu (Jay) and Destiny Cantu (Jesse); Sisters: Anita Lopez (Alfredo), Lottie Vela (Joe), Gloria Marquez (George), Donna Cantu and Raquel Morrill (David); Brothers: Louis Cantu Sr. (Helen), Dan Cantu, Fred Cantu, Paul Cantu (Melissa), Richard Cantu Sr. (Laura) and Raboul Cantu (Miranda) and 14 Grandchildren.

Visitation will begin on Friday, June 21, 2019 at 9:00am at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St., San Antonio, Texas, 78207) with a Prayer Service at 12:00pm. Services will conclude after the prayer service.

Millan-Vasquez

Leocadio Millan-Vasquez, born on June 8, 1954 and went to be with the Lord on June 11, 2019 at the age of 65. He is survived by his Wife: Yolanda Millan; Sons: Leo Millan; Leo M. Millan; Jonathan Millan and Antonio Nunez III; Daughters: Jennifer Millan and Nicole Vanover, Sister: Magda and 5 Grandchildren.

Visitation will begin on Tuesday, June 25, 2019 at 9:00am at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St., San Antonio, Texas, 78207) with a Prayer Service at 12:00pm. Graveside service at Fort Sam Houston National Cemetery at 1:45pm.

Ricarte

Narciso Ricarte Jr., born on January 27, 1966 and went to be with the Lord on June 8, 2019 at the age of 53. He was preceded in death by his Wife: Celia Villa Ricarte. He is survived by his Parents: Narciso and Oralia Ricarte; Sons: Narciso Ricarte III and Scott Eric Ricarte; Sisters: Oralia; Teresa; Bertha and Sandy; Brother: Gene Bustamante (Cynthia).

Visitation will begin on Monday, June 17, 2019 at 4:00pm at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St., San Antonio, Texas, 78207) with a Prayer Service at 7:00pm. Viewing to continue on Tuesday, June 18, 2019 at Delagdo Funeral Home from 8:00am to 10:00am with a Gravesite Service at San Lorenzo Cemetery (FM 2790 and Luckey Rd., Lytle, Texas).

Cervantes

Roberto Nava Cervantes, born on July 11, 1957 and went to be with the Lord on June 13, 2019 at the age of 61. He is survived by his Wife: Gloria Cervantes; Sons: Pedro Cervantes, Robert Cervantes, Joe Hernandez and Philip Hernandez; Daughters: Angela Adames, Ruby Adames, Dazi Cervantes and Cindy Cervantes; Sisters: Mary Falcon and Connie Trejo; Brother: Joe Cervantes, and numerous Grandchildren.

Visitation will begin on Wednesday, June 19, 2019 at 4:00pm at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St., San Antonio, Texas, 78207) with a Rosary recited at 7:00pm. Funeral Service will depart on Thursday, June 20, 2019 at 11:45am for a 12:30pm Mass at Our Lady of Angeles Catholic Church. Interment will follow at Mission Burial Park South.

Contreras

Nazario E. Contreras, born on February 25, 1958 went to be with the Lord on June 12, 2019 at the age of 61. He was preceded in death by his Mother: Maria De Jesus Contreras. He is survived by his Wife: Maria Cruz; Sons: Nazario Contreras Jr. and Frank Hernandez; Daughters: Carol De Leon, Yvette Jaramillo, Isaura Escobedo, Melissa Frasier, Laura Contreras, and Priscylla Contreras; Sisters: Juany and Adela; Brother: Gabriel; and Numerous Grandchildren and Great-grandchildren.

Visitation will begin on Friday, June 14, 2019 at 3:00pm at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St., San Antonio, Texas, 78207) with a Rosary recited at 7:00pm. A Chapel Service will be on Saturday, June 15, 2019 at 2:00pm at Delgado Funeral Home. Interment will follow at Mission Burial Park South.

Rios

Danielle Rios, born in San Antonio, Texas on January 16, 1996 and went to be with the Lord on June 10, 2019 at the age of 23. She is survived by her parents: Jose Rios and JoAnna Rios; boyfriend: Robert Anthony Cervantes; sons: Morrison Nathan Gonzalez and Raiden Anthony Cervantes; daughter: Jamie Z. Hernandez; sisters: Sandy Vee Rios and Margarita Irene Sanchez; brother: Jose Francisco Rios, and grandparents: Nalenbed Perez and Beatrice Garcia.

Visitation will begin on Friday, June 14, 2019 at 9:30am at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St., San Antonio, Texas, 78207) with a Rosary recited at 11:00am. Service will conclude at 12:00pm.

Nunez

Antonio G. Nunez Jr., born in San Antonio, Texas on September 7, 1955 and went to be with the Lord on June 3, 2019 at the age of 64. He is survived by his Ex-wife and Best Friend Yolanda Millan, Son: Antonio Nunez III and wife Kindall; Daughter: Nicole VanOver and future son in law: John Coleman; Sisters: Josefina and Mary; Brother: Raymond(Gloria) and Juan(Rose); Grandchildren: Kaydence VanOver, Cody Nunez, Velosity Nunez and Vincent Vaquera.

Visitation will begin on Tuesday, June 18, 2019 at 4:00pm at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St., San Antonio, Texas, 78207) with a Rosary recited at 7:00pm. Service will conclude at 9:00pm.

Hernandez

Christine Hernandez, born in San Antonio, Texas on October 17, 1968 and went to be with Lord on June 6, 2019 at the age of 50. She was preceded in death by her parents: David and Maria Saldana, and brother: Felipe Ramirez. She is survived by her son: Matthew Hernandez; daughters: Laurissa Jade Hernandez and Tina Marie Cardenas; sisters: Viviana Ramos and Patricia Castillo; brothers: David Saldana and Jesus Ramirez and 4 Grandchildren.

Visitation will begin on Sunday, June 9, 2019 at 4:00pm at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St., San Antonio, Texas, 78207) with a Rosary recited at 7:00pm. Service will conclude 9:00pm.

Cavazos

On June 3, 2019 Thomas G. Cavazos, 56, and his daughters Healey Marie Bustos Cavazos, 10, and Leann Linda Bustos Cavazos, 9, went to be with the Lord. Thomas was born on January 5, 1963 in San Antonio, Texas. He was preceded in death by his Sister: Celina Cavazos. He is survived by his Mother: Dominga Perez; Father: Severo Cavazos; Wife: Viola Cavazos; Son: Thomas Cavazos Jr.; Daughters: Valerie Ann Pueyo (Jeffrey), Vanessa Marie Navarro (Rick) and Veronica Cortez (Fidencio); Sisters: Cynthia Herrera (Freddie), Linda Lassiter (James), Patricia Espinoza (Henry) and Josie Alvarado (Hector); Brothers: Severiano Cavazos (Joann) and Nickolas Cavazos (Sandra); and 10 Grandchildren.

Healey was born on March 3, 2009 and Leann was born on February 9, 2010, both in San Antonio, Texas. They are survived by their Mother: Angel Marie Bustos; Guardians: Cynthia and Freddie Herrera; Brother: Thomas Cavazos Jr.; Sisters: Valerie Ann Pueyo (Jeffrey), Vanessa Marie Navarro (Rick) and Veronica Cortez (Fidencio); Grandparents: Dominga Perez and Severo Cavazos; and numerous Aunts, Uncles, Nephews, Nieces and friends.

Thomas was a hardworking, loving, and devoted father. He had a great friendly personality that made friends wherever he went. He was always joking and trying to make everyone laugh. That same personality rubbed off to his little girls. Those little girls made friends anywhere and everywhere. Healey and Leann were all about hugs and kisses. They were very affectionate. They touched so many hearts. All three had big hearts and will never be forgotten.

Visitation will begin Wednesday, June 12, 2019 at 4:00pm with a Rosary recited at 7:00pm at Delgado Funeral Home (2200 W. Martin St., San Antonio, Texas 78207). Funeral procession will depart Thursday, June 13, 2019 at 12:00pm for a funeral mass at St. Vincent De Paul Catholic Church at 1:00pm. Interment will follow at Mission Burial Park South.

Hartwell

Lucille Moreno Hartwell, 91, of San Antonio, Texas, passed away on Monday June 3, 2019 with her family by her side. Lucille, was born in San Antonio, Texas on March 4, 1928, daughter of the late Basilio Moreno and Luz Gutierrez. She is survived by her husband of 67 years, William B Hartwell; 3 sons: Frank Garza and wife Lisa of San Benito, Texas; Tony C. Hartwell of Corpus Christi, Texas; and William B. Hartwell Jr. and wife Mary of Frisco, Texas; 2 daughters: Mary Sanchez wife of the late Amado R Sanchez of Houston, Texas and Annie Marie Delagarza and husband Joe of San Benito, Texas; 26 grandchildren, 51 great-grandchildren, 5 great-great grandchildren. Moon

Moon Keep me company tonight

sleepless nights and magic light

As i close my eyes tight.

When day is done and i feel alone

Mood here reminds me of home in my dreams.

High in the sky, where angles live, stars shine bright

to my delight. then i can rest

And be at ease my father is watching and whispers come

with me my son and now i am at peace.
